page.title: 04NEW BRIGHTON STATION
page.content: The station opened in 1888. It is a short distance from the promenade. It is built mainly of red brick. It has a clock tower.There is a book in Earlston Road reference library called "Steel Wheels to Deeside"by John Graham,this gives its history.Today the station is used by passengers from West Kirby,Rock Ferry and Liverpool. The ticket man told us that 70 trains per day come into the station. The ladies toilet has a small stove fire in, and old brasstaps on the sinks. there is an old brass light switch and stone tiles on the floor. Where the old waiting room used to be, is now a recording studio where local groups can go and make records.There is also a new cafe in the studio which sells tea, coffee and cakes to travellers.It is called the Whistle Stop.
